content.description: Very dangerous in the sense that some rocks and holds pull off. If you test each hold before committing there is no worry. Crux is right in the middle on the slabbiest part where it's really easy to slip and fall like 30 feet. The top is really easy
content.location: Near middle of The Beast. Higher than The Beast route. Start is obvious. Better description coming soon.

content.description: It's a work in progress to clear the dead vegetation in the usable cracks. The crux is near the middle where the hand holds and foot holds get pretty small. Any miscalculation and your sliding all the way to the bottom.
content.location: The start is the same as Heart Attack. Deviate on the 2nd move after the start of Heart Attack instead of going right and up you move left and up maintaining in the center of the slab. Small crimps in the rock allow for fingers and toes to keep you on the wall. Follow the cracks up to the top and use the crack in the rock on the right at the top to send.

content.description: Many holds are not stable. Make sure to check them thoroughly before committing. It's just you and the rock no ropes or ways to quick draw known yet, so don't fall. Epic view at top and near middle. Experienced climbers with breeze through it.
content.location: Right in the middle of the rock called The Beast is the Route called The Beast. Use the picture to help find the bottom of the route.
